00010 char La_norm_type(const char *typstr)
00011 {
00012     char typup;
00013 
00014     if (strlen(typstr) != 1)
00015         error(
00016             _("argument type[1]='%s' must be a one-letter character string"),
00017             typstr);
00018     typup = toupper(*typstr);
00019     if (typup == '1')
00020         typup = 'O'; /* alias */
00021     else if (typup == 'E')
00022         typup = 'F';
00023     else if (typup != 'M' && typup != 'O' && typup != 'I' && typup != 'F')
00024         error(_("argument type[1]='%s' must be one of 'M','1','O','I','F' or 'E'"),
00025               typstr);
00026     return typup;
00027 }
00028 
00029 char La_rcond_type(const char *typstr)
00030 {
00031     char typup;
00032 
00033     if (strlen(typstr) != 1)
00034         error(
00035             _("argument type[1]='%s' must be a one-letter character string"),
00036             typstr);
00037     typup = toupper(*typstr);
00038     if (typup == '1')
00039         typup = 'O'; /* alias */
00040     else if (typup != 'O' && typup != 'I')
00041         error(_("argument type[1]='%s' must be one of '1','O', or 'I'"),
00042               typstr);
00043     return typup;
00044 }

00047 double get_double_by_name(SEXP obj, char *nm)
00048 {
00049     SEXP nms = getAttrib(obj, R_NamesSymbol);
00050     int i, len = length(obj);
00051 
00052     if ((!isReal(obj)) || (length(obj) > 0 && nms == R_NilValue))
00053         error(_("object must be a named, numeric vector"));
00054     for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00055         if (!strcmp(nm, CHAR(STRING_ELT(nms, i)))) {
00056             return REAL(obj)[i];
00057         }
00058     }
00059     return R_NaReal;
00060 }
00061 
00062 SEXP
00063 set_double_by_name(SEXP obj, double val, char *nm)
00064 {
00065     SEXP nms = getAttrib(obj, R_NamesSymbol);
00066     int i, len = length(obj);
00067 
00068     if ((!isReal(obj)) || (length(obj) > 0 && nms == R_NilValue))
00069         error(_("object must be a named, numeric vector"));
00070     for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00071         if (!strcmp(nm, CHAR(STRING_ELT(nms, i)))) {
00072             REAL(obj)[i] = val;
00073             return obj;
00074         }
00075     }
00076     {
00077         SEXP nx = PROTECT(allocVector(REALSXP, len + 1)),
00078             nnms = allocVector(STRSXP, len + 1);
00079 
00080         setAttrib(nx, R_NamesSymbol, nnms);
00081         for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00082             REAL(nx)[i] = REAL(obj)[i];
00083             SET_STRING_ELT(nnms, i, duplicate(STRING_ELT(nms, i)));
00084         }
00085         REAL(nx)[len] = val;
00086         SET_STRING_ELT(nnms, len, mkChar(nm));
00087         UNPROTECT(1);
00088         return nx;
00089     }
00090 }
00091 
00092 SEXP as_det_obj(double val, int log, int sign)
00093 {
00094     SEXP det = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, 2)),
00095         nms = PROTECT(allocVector(STRSXP, 2)),
00096         vv = PROTECT(ScalarReal(val));
00097 
00098     setAttrib(det, R_NamesSymbol, nms);
00099     SET_STRING_ELT(nms, 0, mkChar("modulus"));
00100     SET_STRING_ELT(nms, 1, mkChar("sign"));
00101     setAttrib(vv, install("logarithm"), ScalarLogical(log));
00102     SET_VECTOR_ELT(det, 0, vv);
00103     SET_VECTOR_ELT(det, 1, ScalarInteger(sign));
00104     setAttrib(det, R_ClassSymbol, mkString("det"));
00105     UNPROTECT(3);
00106     return det;
00107 }

00109 SEXP get_factors(SEXP obj, char *nm)
00110 {
00111     SEXP fac = GET_SLOT(obj, Matrix_factorSym),
00112         nms = getAttrib(fac, R_NamesSymbol);
00113     int i, len = length(fac);
00114 
00115     if ((!isNewList(fac)) || (length(fac) > 0 && nms == R_NilValue))
00116         error(_("'factors' slot must be a named list"));
00117     for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00118         if (!strcmp(nm, CHAR(STRING_ELT(nms, i)))) {
00119             return VECTOR_ELT(fac, i);
00120         }
00121     }
00122     return R_NilValue;
00123 }
00124 
00125 /* In the past this function installed a duplicate of val in the
00126  * factors slot for obj then returned the (typically unprotected)
00127  * val.  This is now changed to return the duplicate, which will be
00128  * protected if obj is protected. */
00129 SEXP set_factors(SEXP obj, SEXP val, char *nm)
00130 {
00131     SEXP fac = GET_SLOT(obj, Matrix_factorSym),
00132         nms = getAttrib(fac, R_NamesSymbol), nfac, nnms;
00133     int i, len = length(fac);
00134 
00135     if ((!isNewList(fac)) || (length(fac) > 0 && nms == R_NilValue))
00136         error(_("'factors' slot must be a named list"));
00137     PROTECT(val); /* set_factors(..) may be called as "finalizer" after UNPROTECT()*/
00138     for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00139         if (!strcmp(nm, CHAR(STRING_ELT(nms, i)))) {
00140             SET_VECTOR_ELT(fac, i, duplicate(val));
00141             return val;
00142         }
00143     }
00144     nfac = PROTECT(allocVector(VECSXP, len + 1));
00145     nnms = PROTECT(allocVector(STRSXP, len + 1));
00146     setAttrib(nfac, R_NamesSymbol, nnms);
00147     for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00148         SET_VECTOR_ELT(nfac, i, VECTOR_ELT(fac, i));
00149         SET_STRING_ELT(nnms, i, duplicate(STRING_ELT(nms, i)));
00150     }
00151     SET_VECTOR_ELT(nfac, len, duplicate(val));
00152     SET_STRING_ELT(nnms, len, mkChar(nm));
00153     SET_SLOT(obj, Matrix_factorSym, nfac);
00154     UNPROTECT(3);
00155     return VECTOR_ELT(nfac, len);
00156 }

00170 /* Fill in the "trivial remainder" in  n*m  array ;
00171  *  typically the 'x' slot of a "dtrMatrix" :
00172  * But should be usable for double/logical/int/complex : */
00173 
00174 #define MAKE_TRIANGULAR_BODY(_TO_, _FROM_, _ZERO_, _ONE_)       \
00175 {                                                               \
00176     int i, j, *dims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(_FROM_, Matrix_DimSym)); \
00177     int n = dims[0], m = dims[1];                               \
00178                                                                 \
00179     if (*uplo_P(_FROM_) == 'U') {                               \
00180         for (j = 0; j < n; j++)                                 \
00181             for (i = j+1; i < m; i++)                           \
00182                 _TO_[i + j*m] = _ZERO_;                         \
00183     } else {                                                    \
00184         for (j = 1; j < n; j++)                                 \
00185             for (i = 0; i < j && i < m; i++)                    \
00186                 _TO_[i + j*m] = _ZERO_;                         \
00187     }                                                           \
00188     if (*diag_P(_FROM_) == 'U') {                               \
00189         j = (n < m) ? n : m;                                    \
00190         for (i = 0; i < j; i++)                                 \
00191             _TO_[i * (m + 1)] = _ONE_;                          \
00192     }                                                           \
00193 }
00194

00197 void make_i_matrix_triangular(int *to, SEXP from)
00198     MAKE_TRIANGULAR_BODY(to, from, 0, 1)

00201 /* Should work for double/logical/int/complex : */
00202 #define MAKE_SYMMETRIC_BODY(_TO_, _FROM_)                       \
00203 {                                                               \
00204     int i, j, n = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(_FROM_, Matrix_DimSym))[0];  \
00205                                                                 \
00206     if (*uplo_P(_FROM_) == 'U') {                               \
00207         for (j = 0; j < n; j++)                                 \
00208             for (i = j+1; i < n; i++)                           \
00209                 _TO_[i + j*n] = _TO_[j + i*n];                  \
00210     } else {                                                    \
00211         for (j = 1; j < n; j++)                                 \
00212             for (i = 0; i < j && i < n; i++)                    \
00213                 _TO_[i + j*n] = _TO_[j + i*n];                  \
00214     }                                                           \
00215 }

00233 SEXP
00234 Matrix_make_named(int TYP, const char **names)
00235 {
00236     SEXP ans, nms;
00237     int i, n;
00238 
00239     for (n = 0; strlen(names[n]) > 0; n++) {}
00240     ans = PROTECT(allocVector(TYP, n));
00241     nms = PROTECT(allocVector(STRSXP, n));
00242     for (i = 0; i < n; i++) SET_STRING_ELT(nms, i, mkChar(names[i]));
00243     setAttrib(ans, R_NamesSymbol, nms);
00244     UNPROTECT(2);
00245     return ans;
00246 }

00250 #define Matrix_Error_Bufsiz    4096
00251 
00262 SEXP check_scalar_string(SEXP sP, char *vals, char *nm)
00263 {
00264     SEXP val = ScalarLogical(1);
00265     char *buf;
00266     /* only allocate when needed: in good case, none is needed */
00267 #define SPRINTF buf = Alloca(Matrix_Error_Bufsiz, char); R_CheckStack(); sprintf
00268 
00269     if (length(sP) != 1) {
00270         SPRINTF(buf, _("'%s' slot must have length 1"), nm);
00271     } else {
00272         const char *str = CHAR(STRING_ELT(sP, 0));
00273         if (strlen(str) != 1) {
00274             SPRINTF(buf, _("'%s' must have string length 1"), nm);
00275         } else {
00276             int i, len, match;
00277             for (i = 0, len = strlen(vals), match = 0; i < len; i++) {
00278                 if (str[0] == vals[i])
00279                     return R_NilValue;
00280             }
00281             SPRINTF(buf, _("'%s' must be in '%s'"), nm, vals);
00282         }
00283     }
00284     /* 'error' returns : */
00285     val = mkString(buf);
00286     return val;
00287 #undef SPRINTF
00288 }
00289 
00290 /* FIXME? Something like this should be part of the R API ?
00291  *        But then, R has the more general  compute_identical()
00292  * in src/main/identical.c: Rboolean compute_identical(SEXP x, SEXP y);
00293 */
00294 Rboolean equal_string_vectors(SEXP s1, SEXP s2)
00295 {
00296     Rboolean n1 = isNull(s1), n2 = isNull(s2);
00297     if (n1 || n2)
00298         return (n1 == n2) ? TRUE : FALSE;
00299     else if (TYPEOF(s1) != STRSXP || TYPEOF(s2) != STRSXP) {
00300         error(_("'s1' and 's2' must be \"character\" vectors"));
00301         return FALSE; /* -Wall */
00302     } else {
00303         int n = LENGTH(s1), i;
00304         if (n != LENGTH(s2))
00305             return FALSE;
00306         for(i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00307             /* note that compute_identical() code for STRSXP
00308                is careful about NA's which we don't need */
00309             if(strcmp(CHAR(STRING_ELT(s1, i)),
00310                       CHAR(STRING_ELT(s2, i))))
00311                 return FALSE;
00312         }
00313         return TRUE; /* they *are* equal */
00314     }
00315 }

00317 
00318 SEXP dense_nonpacked_validate(SEXP obj)
00319 {
00320     int *dims = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(obj, Matrix_DimSym));
00321     if ((dims[0] * dims[1]) != length(GET_SLOT(obj, Matrix_xSym)))
00322         return mkString(_("length of x slot != prod(Dim)"));
00323     return ScalarLogical(1);
00324 }

00326 
00327 #define PACKED_TO_FULL(TYPE)                                            \
00328 TYPE *packed_to_full_ ## TYPE(TYPE *dest, const TYPE *src,              \
00329                         int n, enum CBLAS_UPLO uplo)                    \
00330 {                                                                       \
00331     int i, j, pos = 0;                                                  \
00332                                                                         \
00333     AZERO(dest, n*n);                                                   \
00334     for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {                                           \
00335         switch(uplo) {                                                  \
00336         case UPP:                                                       \
00337             for (i = 0; i <= j; i++) dest[i + j * n] = src[pos++];      \
00338             break;                                                      \
00339         case LOW:                                                       \
00340             for (i = j; i < n; i++) dest[i + j * n] = src[pos++];       \
00341             break;                                                      \
00342         default:                                                        \
00343             error(_("'uplo' must be UPP or LOW"));                      \
00344         }                                                               \
00345     }                                                                   \
00346     return dest;                                                        \
00347 }
00348 
00349 PACKED_TO_FULL(double)
00350 PACKED_TO_FULL(int)
00351 
00352 #define FULL_TO_PACKED(TYPE)                                            \
00353 TYPE *full_to_packed_ ## TYPE(TYPE *dest, const TYPE *src, int n,       \
00354                       enum CBLAS_UPLO uplo, enum CBLAS_DIAG diag)       \
00355 {                                                                       \
00356     int i, j, pos = 0;                                                  \
00357                                                                         \
00358     for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {                                           \
00359         switch(uplo) {                                                  \
00360         case UPP:                                                       \
00361             for (i = 0; i <= j; i++)                                    \
00362                 dest[pos++] = (i == j && diag== UNT) ? 1 : src[i + j*n]; \
00363             break;                                                      \
00364         case LOW:                                                       \
00365             for (i = j; i < n; i++)                                     \
00366                 dest[pos++] = (i == j && diag== UNT) ? 1 : src[i + j*n]; \
00367             break;                                                      \
00368         default:                                                        \
00369             error(_("'uplo' must be UPP or LOW"));                      \
00370         }                                                               \
00371     }                                                                   \
00372     return dest;                                                        \
00373 }

00389 void d_packed_getDiag(double *dest, SEXP x, int n)
00390 {
00391     double *xx = REAL(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_xSym));
00392 
00393 #define END_packed_getDiag                                              \
00394     int j, pos = 0;                                                     \
00395                                                                         \
00396     if (*uplo_P(x) == 'U') {                                            \
00397         for(pos= 0, j=0; j < n; pos += 1+(++j))  dest[j] = xx[pos];     \
00398     } else {                                                            \
00399         for(pos= 0, j=0; j < n; pos += (n - j), j++) dest[j] = xx[pos]; \
00400     }                                                                   \
00401     return
00402 
00403     END_packed_getDiag;
00404 }
00405 
00406 void l_packed_getDiag(int *dest, SEXP x, int n)
00407 {
00408     int *xx = LOGICAL(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_xSym));
00409 
00410     END_packed_getDiag;
00411 }
00412 
00413 #undef END_packed_getDiag

00415 void tr_d_packed_getDiag(double *dest, SEXP x)
00416 {
00417     int n = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym))[0];
00418     SEXP val = PROTECT(allocVector(REALSXP, n));
00419     double *v = REAL(val);
00420 
00421     if (*diag_P(x) == 'U') {
00422         int j;
00423         for (j = 0; j < n; j++) v[j] = 1.;
00424     } else {
00425         d_packed_getDiag(v, x, n);
00426     }
00427     UNPROTECT(1);
00428     return;
00429 }
00430 
00431 void tr_l_packed_getDiag(   int *dest, SEXP x)
00432 {
00433     int n = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(x, Matrix_DimSym))[0];
00434     SEXP val = PROTECT(allocVector(LGLSXP, n));
00435     int *v = LOGICAL(val);
00436 
00437     if (*diag_P(x) == 'U') {
00438         int j;
00439         for (j = 0; j < n; j++) v[j] = 1;
00440     } else {
00441         l_packed_getDiag(v, x, n);
00442     }
00443     UNPROTECT(1);
00444     return;
00445 }

00447 SEXP Matrix_expand_pointers(SEXP pP)
00448 {
00449     int n = length(pP) - 1;
00450     int *p = INTEGER(pP);
00451     SEXP ans = PROTECT(allocVector(INTSXP, p[n]));
00452 
00453     expand_cmprPt(n, p, INTEGER(ans));
00454     UNPROTECT(1);
00455     return ans;
00456 }

00467 SEXP
00468 Matrix_getElement(SEXP list, char *nm) {
00469     SEXP names = getAttrib(list, R_NamesSymbol);
00470     int i;
00471 
00472     for (i = 0; i < LENGTH(names); i++)
00473         if (!strcmp(CHAR(STRING_ELT(names, i)), nm))
00474             return(VECTOR_ELT(list, i));
00475     return R_NilValue;

00486 static double *
00487 install_diagonal(double *dest, SEXP A)
00488 {
00489     int nc = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_DimSym))[0];
00490     int i, ncp1 = nc + 1, unit = *diag_P(A) == 'U';
00491     double *ax = REAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym));
00492 
00493     AZERO(dest, nc * nc);
00494     for (i = 0; i < nc; i++)
00495         dest[i * ncp1] = (unit) ? 1. : ax[i];
00496     return dest;
00497 }
00498 
00499 static int *
00500 install_diagonal_int(int *dest, SEXP A)
00501 {
00502     int nc = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_DimSym))[0];
00503     int i, ncp1 = nc + 1, unit = *diag_P(A) == 'U';
00504     int *ax = INTEGER(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym));
00505 
00506     AZERO(dest, nc * nc);
00507     for (i = 0; i < nc; i++)
00508         dest[i * ncp1] = (unit) ? 1 : ax[i];
00509     return dest;
00510 }

00520 /* NOTA BENE: If you enlarge this list, do change '14' and '6' below !
00521  * ---------  ddiMatrix & ldiMatrix  are no longer ddense or ldense on the R level,
00522  *            ---         ---        but are still dealt with here.
00523  */
00524 
00525 #define ddense_CLASSES                                                  \
00526                     "dgeMatrix", "dtrMatrix",                           \
00527                     "dsyMatrix", "dpoMatrix", "ddiMatrix",              \
00528                     "dtpMatrix", "dspMatrix", "dppMatrix",              \
00529                     /* sub classes of those above:*/                    \
00530                     /* dtr */ "Cholesky", "LDL", "BunchKaufman",        \
00531                     /* dtp */ "pCholesky", "pBunchKaufman",             \
00532                     /* dpo */ "corMatrix"
00533 
00534 #define ldense_CLASSES                                  \
00535                     "lgeMatrix", "ltrMatrix",           \
00536                     "lsyMatrix", "ldiMatrix",           \
00537                     "ltpMatrix", "lspMatrix"
00538 
00539 #define ndense_CLASSES                                  \
00540                     "ngeMatrix", "ntrMatrix",           \
00541                     "nsyMatrix",                        \
00542                     "ntpMatrix", "nspMatrix"
00543 
00544 /* Generalized -- "geMatrix" -- dispatch where needed : */
00545 SEXP dup_mMatrix_as_geMatrix(SEXP A)
00546 {
00547     SEXP ans, ad = R_NilValue, an = R_NilValue; /* -Wall */
00548     char *valid[] = {"_NOT_A_CLASS_",/* *_CLASSES defined in ./Mutils.h */
00549                     ddense_CLASSES, /* 14 */
00550                     ldense_CLASSES, /* 6  */
00551                     ndense_CLASSES, /* 5  */
00552                     ""};
00553     int sz, ctype = Matrix_check_class_etc(A, valid),
00554         nprot = 1;
00555     enum dense_enum { ddense, ldense, ndense } M_type = ddense /* -Wall */;
00556 
00557     if (ctype > 0) { /* a [nld]denseMatrix object */
00558         ad = GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_DimSym);
00559         an = GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_DimNamesSym);
00560         M_type = (ctype <= 14) ? ddense :
00561             ((ctype <= 14+6) ? ldense : ndense);
00562     }
00563     else if (ctype < 0) {       /* not a (recognized) classed matrix */
00564 
00565         if (isReal(A))
00566             M_type = ddense;
00567         else if (isInteger(A)) {
00568             A = PROTECT(coerceVector(A, REALSXP));
00569             nprot++;
00570             M_type = ddense;
00571         }
00572         else if (isLogical(A))
00573             M_type = ldense;
00574         else
00575             error(_("invalid class '%s' to dup_mMatrix_as_geMatrix"),
00576                   class_P(A));
00577 
00578 #define DUP_MMATRIX_NON_CLASS                                           \
00579         if (isMatrix(A)) {      /* "matrix" */                          \
00580             ad = getAttrib(A, R_DimSymbol);                             \
00581             an = getAttrib(A, R_DimNamesSymbol);                        \
00582         } else {/* maybe "numeric" (incl integer,logical) --> (n x 1) */\
00583             int* dd = INTEGER(ad = PROTECT(allocVector(INTSXP, 2)));    \
00584             nprot++;                                                    \
00585             dd[0] = LENGTH(A);                                          \
00586             dd[1] = 1;                                                  \
00587             an = R_NilValue;                                            \
00588         }                                                               \
00589         ctype = 0
00590 
00591         DUP_MMATRIX_NON_CLASS;
00592     }
00593 
00594     ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS(M_type == ddense ? "dgeMatrix" :
00595                                         (M_type == ldense ? "lgeMatrix" :
00596                                          "ngeMatrix"))));
00597 #define DUP_MMATRIX_SET_1                                       \
00598     SET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym, duplicate(ad));                \
00599     SET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimNamesSym, (LENGTH(an) == 2) ?       \
00600              duplicate(an): allocVector(VECSXP, 2));            \
00601     sz = INTEGER(ad)[0] * INTEGER(ad)[1]
00602 
00603     DUP_MMATRIX_SET_1;
00604 
00605     if(M_type == ddense) { /* ddense -> dge */
00606 
00607         double *ansx;
00608 
00609 #define DUP_MMATRIX_ddense_CASES                                                \
00610         ansx = REAL(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym, REALSXP, sz));                 \
00611         switch(ctype) {                                                         \
00612         case 0:                 /* unclassed real matrix */                     \
00613             Memcpy(ansx, REAL(A), sz);                                          \
00614             break;                                                              \
00615         case 1:                 /* dgeMatrix */                                 \
00616             Memcpy(ansx, REAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym)), sz);                   \
00617             break;                                                              \
00618         case 2:                 /* dtrMatrix   and subclasses */                \
00619         case 9: case 10: case 11:   /* ---      Cholesky, LDL, BunchKaufman */  \
00620             Memcpy(ansx, REAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym)), sz);                   \
00621             make_d_matrix_triangular(ansx, A);                                  \
00622             break;                                                              \
00623         case 3:                 /* dsyMatrix */                                 \
00624         case 4:                 /* dpoMatrix  + subclass */                     \
00625         case 14:                        /* ---  corMatrix */                    \
00626             Memcpy(ansx, REAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym)), sz);                   \
00627             make_d_matrix_symmetric(ansx, A);                                   \
00628             break;                                                              \
00629         case 5:                 /* ddiMatrix */                                 \
00630             install_diagonal(ansx, A);                                          \
00631             break;                                                              \
00632         case 6:                 /* dtpMatrix  + subclasses */                   \
00633         case 12: case 13:               /* ---  pCholesky, pBunchKaufman */     \
00634             packed_to_full_double(ansx, REAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym)),         \
00635                                   INTEGER(ad)[0],                               \
00636                                   *uplo_P(A) == 'U' ? UPP : LOW);               \
00637             make_d_matrix_triangular(ansx, A);                                  \
00638             break;                                                              \
00639         case 7:                 /* dspMatrix */                                 \
00640         case 8:                 /* dppMatrix */                                 \
00641             packed_to_full_double(ansx, REAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym)),         \
00642                                   INTEGER(ad)[0],                               \
00643                                   *uplo_P(A) == 'U' ? UPP : LOW);               \
00644             make_d_matrix_symmetric(ansx, A);                                   \
00645             break;                                                              \
00646         }  /* switch(ctype) */
00647 
00648         DUP_MMATRIX_ddense_CASES
00649 
00650     }
00651     else { /* M_type == ldense || M_type = ndense  */
00652         /* ldense -> lge */
00653         /* ndense -> nge */
00654         int *ansx = LOGICAL(ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym, LGLSXP, sz));
00655 
00656         switch(ctype) {
00657         case 0:                 /* unclassed logical matrix */
00658             Memcpy(ansx, LOGICAL(A), sz);
00659             break;
00660 
00661         case 1+14:                      /* lgeMatrix */
00662         case 1+14+6:                    /* ngeMatrix */
00663             Memcpy(ansx, LOGICAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym)), sz);
00664             break;
00665         case 2+14:                      /* ltrMatrix */
00666         case 2+14+6:                    /* ntrMatrix */
00667             Memcpy(ansx, LOGICAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym)), sz);
00668             make_i_matrix_triangular(ansx, A);
00669             break;
00670         case 3+14:                      /* lsyMatrix */
00671         case 3+14+6:                    /* nsyMatrix */
00672             Memcpy(ansx, LOGICAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym)), sz);
00673             make_i_matrix_symmetric(ansx, A);
00674             break;
00675         case 4+14:                      /* ldiMatrix */
00676         case 4+14+6:                    /* ndiMatrix */
00677             install_diagonal_int(ansx, A);
00678             break;
00679         case 5+14:                      /* ltpMatrix */
00680         case 5+14+6:                    /* ntpMatrix */
00681             packed_to_full_int(ansx, LOGICAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym)),
00682                                INTEGER(ad)[0],
00683                                *uplo_P(A) == 'U' ? UPP : LOW);
00684             make_i_matrix_triangular(ansx, A);
00685             break;
00686         case 6+14:                      /* lspMatrix */
00687         case 6+14+6:                    /* nspMatrix */
00688             packed_to_full_int(ansx, LOGICAL(GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_xSym)),
00689                                INTEGER(ad)[0],
00690                                *uplo_P(A) == 'U' ? UPP : LOW);
00691             make_i_matrix_symmetric(ansx, A);
00692             break;
00693 
00694         default:
00695             error(_("unexpected ctype = %d in dup_mMatrix_as_geMatrix"), ctype);
00696         }  /* switch(ctype) */
00697 
00698     }  /* if(M_type == .) */
00699 
00700     UNPROTECT(nprot);
00701     return ans;
00702 }
00703 
00704 SEXP dup_mMatrix_as_dgeMatrix(SEXP A)
00705 {
00706     SEXP ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS("dgeMatrix"))),
00707         ad = R_NilValue , an = R_NilValue;      /* -Wall */
00708     char *valid[] = {"_NOT_A_CLASS_", ddense_CLASSES, ""};
00709     int ctype = Matrix_check_class_etc(A, valid),
00710         nprot = 1, sz;
00711     double *ansx;
00712 
00713     if (ctype > 0) {            /* a ddenseMatrix object */
00714         ad = GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_DimSym);
00715         an = GET_SLOT(A, Matrix_DimNamesSym);
00716     }
00717     else if (ctype < 0) {       /* not a (recognized) classed matrix */
00718 
00719         DUP_MMATRIX_NON_CLASS;
00720 
00721         if (isInteger(A) || isLogical(A)) {
00722             A = PROTECT(coerceVector(A, REALSXP));
00723             nprot++;
00724         }
00725         if (!isReal(A))
00726             error(_("invalid class '%s' to dup_mMatrix_as_dgeMatrix"),
00727                   class_P(A));
00728     }
00729 
00730     DUP_MMATRIX_SET_1;
00731 
00732     DUP_MMATRIX_ddense_CASES
00733 
00734     UNPROTECT(nprot);
00735     return ans;
00736 }
00737 
00738 
00739 SEXP new_dgeMatrix(int nrow, int ncol)
00740 {
00741     SEXP ans = PROTECT(NEW_OBJECT(MAKE_CLASS("dgeMatrix"))),
00742          ad = PROTECT(allocVector(INTSXP, 2));
00743 
00744     INTEGER(ad)[0] = nrow;
00745     INTEGER(ad)[1] = ncol;
00746     SET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimSym, ad);
00747     SET_SLOT(ans, Matrix_DimNamesSym, allocVector(VECSXP, 2));
00748     ALLOC_SLOT(ans, Matrix_xSym, REALSXP, nrow * ncol);
00749 
00750     UNPROTECT(2);
00751     return ans;
00752 }
00753 
00763 SEXP m_encodeInd(SEXP ij, SEXP di, SEXP chk_bnds)
00764 {
00765     SEXP ans;
00766     int *ij_di = NULL, n, *Di = INTEGER(di), *IJ, *j_;
00767     Rboolean check_bounds = asLogical(chk_bnds);
00768 
00769     ij = PROTECT(coerceVector(ij, INTSXP));
00770     if(!isMatrix(ij) ||
00771        (ij_di = INTEGER(getAttrib(ij, R_DimSymbol)))[1] != 2)
00772         error(_("Argument ij must be 2-column integer matrix"));
00773     n = ij_di[0];
00774     IJ = INTEGER(ij);
00775     j_ = IJ+n;/* pointer offset! */
00776 
00777     if((Di[0] * (double) Di[1]) >= 1 + (double)INT_MAX) { /* need double */
00778         ans = PROTECT(allocVector(REALSXP, n));
00779         double *ii = REAL(ans), nr = (double) Di[0];
00780 #define do_ii_FILL(_i_, _j_)                                    \
00781         int i;                                                          \
00782         if(check_bounds) {                                              \
00783             for(i=0; i < n; i++) {                                      \
00784                 if(_i_[i] == NA_INTEGER || _j_[i] == NA_INTEGER)        \
00785                     ii[i] = NA_INTEGER;                                 \
00786                 else {                                                  \
00787                     if(_i_[i] < 0 || _i_[i] >= Di[0])                   \
00788                         error(_("subscript 'i' out of bounds in M[ij]")); \
00789                     if(_j_[i] < 0 || _j_[i] >= Di[1])                   \
00790                         error(_("subscript 'j' out of bounds in M[ij]")); \
00791                     ii[i] = _i_[i] + _j_[i] * nr;                       \
00792                 }                                                       \
00793             }                                                           \
00794         } else {                                                        \
00795             for(i=0; i < n; i++)                                        \
00796                 ii[i] = (_i_[i] == NA_INTEGER || _j_[i] == NA_INTEGER)  \
00797                     ? NA_INTEGER : _i_[i] + _j_[i] * nr;                \
00798         }
00799 
00800         do_ii_FILL(IJ, j_);
00801     } else {
00802         ans = PROTECT(allocVector(INTSXP, n));
00803         int *ii = INTEGER(ans), nr = Di[0];
00804 
00805         do_ii_FILL(IJ, j_);
00806     }
00807     UNPROTECT(2);
00808     return ans;
00809 }
00810 
00821 SEXP m_encodeInd2(SEXP i, SEXP j, SEXP di, SEXP chk_bnds)
00822 {
00823     SEXP ans;
00824     int n = LENGTH(i);
00825     int *Di = INTEGER(di), *i_, *j_;
00826     Rboolean check_bounds = asLogical(chk_bnds);
00827 
00828     if(LENGTH(j) != n || !isInteger(i) || !isInteger(j))
00829         error(_("i and j must be integer vectors of the same length"));
00830     i_ = INTEGER(i);
00831     j_ = INTEGER(j);
00832 
00833     if((Di[0] * (double) Di[1]) >= 1 + (double)INT_MAX) { /* need double */
00834         ans = PROTECT(allocVector(REALSXP, n));
00835         double *ii = REAL(ans), nr = (double) Di[0];
00836 
00837         do_ii_FILL(i_, j_);
00838     } else {
00839         ans = PROTECT(allocVector(INTSXP, n));
00840         int *ii = INTEGER(ans), nr = Di[0];
00841 
00842         do_ii_FILL(i_, j_);
00843     }
00844     UNPROTECT(1);
00845     return ans;
00846 }
00847 #undef do_ii_FILL
00848 
00849 
00860 int Matrix_check_class_and_super(SEXP x, char **valid, SEXP rho)
00861 {
00862     int ans;
00863     SEXP cl = getAttrib(x, R_ClassSymbol);
00864     const char *class = CHAR(asChar(cl));
00865     for (ans = 0; ; ans++) {
00866         if (!strlen(valid[ans]))
00867             break;
00868         if (!strcmp(class, valid[ans])) return ans;
00869     }
00870     /* if not found directly, now search the non-virtual super classes :*/
00871     if(IS_S4_OBJECT(x)) {
00872         /* now try the superclasses, i.e.,  try   is(x, "....") : */
00873         SEXP classExts, superCl, _call;
00874         int i;
00875 /*      PROTECT(cl); */
00876         PROTECT(_call = lang2(install("getClassDef"), cl));
00877         classExts = GET_SLOT(eval(_call, rho),
00878                                      install("contains"));
00879         UNPROTECT(1);
00880         PROTECT(classExts);
00881         PROTECT(_call = lang3(install(".selectSuperClasses"), classExts,
00882                               /* dropVirtual = */ ScalarLogical(1)));
00883         superCl = eval(_call, rho);
00884         UNPROTECT(2);
00885         PROTECT(superCl);
00886         for(i=0; i < length(superCl); i++) {
00887             const char *s_class = CHAR(STRING_ELT(superCl, i));
00888             for (ans = 0; ; ans++) {
00889                 if (!strlen(valid[ans]))
00890                     break;
00891                 if (!strcmp(s_class, valid[ans])) {
00892                     UNPROTECT(1);
00893                     return ans;
00894                 }
00895             }
00896         }
00897         UNPROTECT(1);
00898     }
00899     return -1;
00900 }
00901 
00912 int Matrix_check_class_etc(SEXP x, char **valid)
00913 {
00914     SEXP cl = getAttrib(x, R_ClassSymbol), rho = R_GlobalEnv,
00915         M_classEnv_sym = install(".M.classEnv"), pkg;
00916 
00917 /*     PROTECT(cl); */
00918 
00919 #if defined(R_VERSION) && R_VERSION >= R_Version(2, 10, 0)
00920     pkg = getAttrib(cl, R_PackageSymbol); /* ==R== packageSlot(class(x)) */
00921 #else
00922     pkg = getAttrib(cl, install("package"));
00923 #endif
00924     if(!isNull(pkg)) { /* find  rho := correct class Environment */
00925         SEXP clEnvCall;
00926         /* need to make sure we find ".M.classEnv" even if Matrix is not
00927            attached, but just namespace-loaded: */
00928 
00929         /* Matrix::: does not work here either ... :
00930          *          rho = eval(lang2(install("Matrix:::.M.classEnv"), cl), */
00931 
00932         /* Now make this work via .onLoad() hack in ../R/zzz.R  : */
00933         PROTECT(clEnvCall = lang2(M_classEnv_sym, cl));
00934         rho = eval(clEnvCall, R_GlobalEnv);
00935         UNPROTECT(1);
00936 
00937         if(!isEnvironment(rho))
00938             error(_("could not find correct environment; please report!"));
00939     }
00940 /*     UNPROTECT(1); */
00941     return Matrix_check_class_and_super(x, valid, rho);
00942 }
